stories.text:
This plugin creates Word Wise and X-Ray sqlite files for Kindle format books, it also adds these data as <ruby> tags and footnotes to EPUB books. If an e-reader device is connected, it'll send the book and created files to the device.

It uses spaCy to find named entities as X-Ray, 22 languages are supported. X-Ray descriptions come from Wikipedia, locator map, Democracy Index and country/city inception data are queried from Wikidata. Wiktionary files downloaded from https://kaikki.org are used for EPUB Word Wise.
stories.title: Show HN: WordDumb, a calibre plugin that helps you read books

stories.text:
I am driving myself crazy trying to find a combination that will allow me to setup an offline react native app with a graph database.

Tick off the common suggestions:

1- No this is not for state management (Redux, Redux-persist)

2- I don't want to use sqlite or any other relational setup

3- I don't want to use serialize then async store

Now that we have those out of the way realm DB is promising but it requires the app to use the db in single thread mode, doesn't support dynamic schema changes and outside of realm-orm I don't see anywhere where I can type it to TS

Apollo client with persistence seems promising but I am concerned that this is a caching solution not a first class offline support.

Actualbudget (a local first app) is doing sqlite3 (table storage) and CDRTs message queue for eventual consistency. I am curious how anytype.io is storing their graph at the edge.

The short pitch is: imagine if you had a structured graph of your personal data (private & synchronized offline), we would be able to build tons of cross silo solutions. My first use case is to identify low frequency NERs so that i can have a personalized RSS reader.
stories.title: Ask HN: How to have GraphQL in an offline only React Native application
